Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intravenous Magnesium in Remifentanil-Based Anesthesia

Objective.evidence: This study assesses whether intravenous magnesium, an NMDA receptor antagonist, can reduce postoperative pain and analgesic needs in adults receiving remifentanil-based anesthesia.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were postoperative analgesic requirements and pain scores within 24 hours.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Twenty-two RCTs involving 1362 participants were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Magnesium significantly decreased 24-hour analgesic requirements (SMD −1.51; 95% CI −2.15 to −0.87; p < 0.0001) and pain scores (SMD −0.61; 95% CI −0.90 to −0.32; p < 0.0001)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were not significantly different between groups.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered on PROSPERO (CRD42024609911).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by institutional grants.
